snippet: With money allocated by the Obama health care law, local governments are creating programs to help curb the incidence of obesity and other diseases and promote healthy lifestyles.
abstract: Local governments across the country are using money allocated by the Affordable Care Act to create programs that help curb the incidence of obesity and other diseases and promote healthy lifestyles; trend is part of a national effort set in motion by the law to move from a reactionary health care system to one based on prevention.
lead_paragraph: With money allocated by the Obama health care law, local governments are creating programs to help curb the incidence of obesity and other diseases and promote healthy lifestyles.

headline.seo: Door to Door in Oklahoma City, Preaching Healthy Living
headline.main: Door to Door in the Heartland, Preaching Healthy Living
